parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
Today's tip is about caring for yourself. 

In tough times like these, it's normal to feel overwhelmed. Remember, it is important to take a moment for yourself, no matter how small.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Taking care of yourself helps you be there for your children during tough times.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 4 tips on how to take care of yourself:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **REST**

Look after yourself as much as possible and try to rest when you can.

Try to do something that helps you relax.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **CONNECT**

Connect with loved ones as often as you can.

Find someone you can talk to about how you are feeling.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **BREATHE**

Take a moment each day to listen to your breath as it goes in and out.

Losing your temper? Breathe in and out slowly five times.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ **CARE**

Make sure to take care of yourself so you can feel better and be there for your family. 

Remember to praise yourself each time you take steps to cope.
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Remember, you're doing the best you can. Be proud.

parenting_crisis_universal.module_name: Make a Routine for Time Together
parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
Today's tip is about making a routine for your children. 

When we are in crisis, things can feel unfamiliar. Having routines helps your children feel safe and stable.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: When you do the same things every day, it makes life more familiar for your children. It also makes them feel less worried and more secure.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ tips on making routines to spend time together with your children:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **DO IT DAILY**

Even when it feels hard, try to have some activities that you and your children do every day for yourself and your children.

If you can, help children with daily routines like eating together and cleaning.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PLAY EVERY DAY**

Try to set aside time to play or spend quality time with your children every day. 

Playing with and talking to children for a few minutes every day helps them feel secure.
Ask children what they would like to do.

Listen to them, look at them, and give them your full attention.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **PRACTISE BEING CALM**

Our children learn calmness and kindness from us.

Every day, try telling yourself a calming message. 

Try “I can do this, I am trying my best.”
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.4.text:
Small amounts of time can help children feel safe and loved.

After this lesson, you can type {PLAY} to get some activity ideas to do with children.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.intro: Here are some regular activities you might want to try to do with your children:
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Parenting is not always easy. Well done for doing the best you can.

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
Today's tip is about helping your children cope with crisis. 

It is normal to be worried about your children, especially during tough times   

Children might face emotions and challenges they don’t know how to handle.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: There are things you can do to help them feel better now and make them stronger for the future.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ tips on how you can support your children during tough times:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **LISTEN**

Children may be scared, confused and angry. They need your support.

Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling.

Tell them whatever they are feeling is okay, and give them comfort.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PRAISE YOUR CHILDREN**

Ask children to help with day-to-day tasks, such as making food or cleaning.

Praise them for trying or doing well. This encourages helpful behaviour.

Praising children shows them that you notice and care.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **PRAISE YOURSELF**

Every day before you sleep, praise yourself for trying to help your children cope.

Thinking of even 1 thing you are proud of can make a difference!
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Remember to also praise yourself for doing the best you can do.

parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
Today's tip is about helping your children when someone dies. 

Losing a loved one is painful for everyone, including children. 

Children may feel overwhelmed and upset when someone dies.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: Talking to your children about death can be hard, but it will help them make sense of what is happening.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ tips on how to help your children when someone dies:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **BE CLEAR**

In simple words, tell them the person has died and will not come back.

If one of their caregivers has died, tell children who they will live with and who will look after them – they often worry about this.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **ACCEPT FEELINGS** 

There is no right way for a child to react to loss. Children may act happy but still feel sad.

Listen to your child and tell them whatever you are feeling is okay.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **SAY GOODBYE**

Do something together to say goodbye to the person – a song, letter or prayer.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.intro: Let us understand how children of different ages react to death.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.1: Small children under the age of 5 years may ask if the person who has died is coming back.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.2: They might hold onto you or other caregivers more or start doing things they used to do when they were younger, like wetting the bed.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.3: Older children between 6 and 11 years old may ask more questions and want to understand what happened.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.4: They may show their grief through anger and experience physical aches or pains.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.5: Adolescents and young teenagers from around the age of 12 years will wonder about why things happen.
parenting_crisis_universal.comic.text.6: Their reactions will vary and can include lack of interest, anger, extreme sadness and poor concentration.
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Parenting is full of difficult conversations. Take a moment to care for yourself.

parenting_crisis_universal.module_name: Protect our Children from Sexual Violence
parenting_crisis_universal.introduction.msg_list:
Today's tip is about protecting our children from sexual violence. 

During difficult times, children are more likely to face dangers like sexual violence.

Sexual violence means someone is forced into sexual activities they don't want to do.
parenting_crisis_universal.importance.msg_list: By listening in a supportive way and talking openly with your children, you are helping them to stay as safe and well as possible.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ tips for protecting your child from sexual violence:
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ *NO IS OK!*

Teach your child that no one has the right to touch them or make them uncomfortable.

Practice saying "no" loudly and strongly together. 

Remember, you can do this with words and with body. 

Talking about this with your child helps protect them.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **TELL AN ADULT**

Tell them that abusers often trick children by asking them to keep sexual violence a “secret”.

Remind them that they don’t have to keep secrets from their parents.
parenting_crisis_universal.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **COMFORT YOUR CHILD**

If your child tells you about sexual violence, trust them.

Reassure them it’s not their fault and they are safe and loved.

You can type {HELP} for resources if your child shares sexual violence with you.
parenting_crisis_universal.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Talking about sexual violence with your children will go a long way to protect them. It is not easy but necessary. They are lucky to have you. Be proud of yourself.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list: Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called "Breath and Body Awareness".

Press ▶️ to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message: Press ▶️ to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.intro: Today's pause is called "Breath and Body Awareness".
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Start by taking a deep breath.
 
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. 

Notice how your body feels.
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Continue to take deep breaths.

Feel your breath as it goes in and out.

Notice any emotions you are feeling. Are there feelings of happiness, excitement, worry?

Whatever you are feeling is okay.
take_a_pause.tips.message.3.text:
Now, expand your awareness to your whole body. 

Listen to the sounds in the room.
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text:
Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. 

When you are ready, continue to your lesson with a sense of calm.
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list: Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called "Body Scan".

Press ▶️ to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message: Press ▶️ to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Begin by taking a full breath in and a long breath out. 

Now bringing awareness to the top of your body, your head, face, neck, shoulders. 

Noticing any sensations, movements, any places of holding.
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Continue to scan your body, moving down the arms and hands and into your fingers. 


Sense the back of your body and your lower back.
take_a_pause.tips.message.3.text:
Feeling the contact of your body with the chair if you are seated. 

Now sensing your upper legs, your lower legs, and the feet.
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text: Finish this pause by taking a full deep breath in and a long breath out.
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list:
Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. 

Sometimes when we are experiencing stress or feeling alone, it can be helpful to send thoughts of loving kindness to ourselves.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called "Loving Kindness Meditation".

Press ▶️ to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message: Press ▶️ to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.intro: Today's pause is called "Loving Kindness Meditation".
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Find a comfortable sitting position, your feet flat on the floor, your hands resting in your lap. 

Ask yourself, “What is my experience in this moment?”
take_a_pause.tips.message.2.text:
Notice what thoughts you are experiencing. 

Notice how you feel emotionally. 

Notice how your body feels. Notice any discomfort or tension.
take_a_pause.tips.message.3.text:
Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. 

You can then say the following words silently to yourself: 

May I be peaceful. 

May I be safe. 

May I be healthy. 

May I be happy. 

May I feel loved. 

Repeat slowly once or twice taking your time between each phrase.
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text:
If you feel comfortable, you can also send thoughts of loving-kindness to your child, your partner, your family, and anyone else who is close to you in your life.

Now, allow your focus to expand to the whole body. 

Allow your focus to expand to the sounds in the room.
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 

When you are ready, continue to today's lesson with a sense of calm. 

Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us.

take_a_pause.introduction.msg_list: Before we begin today's lesson, let's take a pause together. Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
take_a_pause.video.message:
Today's pause is called "Box Breathing."

Press ▶️ to watch a video to practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.audio.message: Press ▶️ to listen to an audio and practise taking a pause together
take_a_pause.tips.message.1.text:
Inhale to the count of 4 as you visualize the top edge of a box.

Hold your breath for a count of 4, as you go down along the right side.

Exhale for a count of 4, moving from right to left along the bottom edge.

Hold for another count of 4, going up along the left side, back to the top.

Repeat for several cycles for at least 1 minute.
take_a_pause.tips.message.4.text:
Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. 

When you are ready, continue to your lesson with a sense of calm.
take_a_pause.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.

parenting_crisis_political.introduction.msg_list: Keeping children safe can feel overwhelming, especially when dealing with unexpected challenges.
parenting_crisis_political.importance.msg_list: In such moments, having a clear plan will help you and your children know what to do to be safe.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ tips on how to keep your children safe in an unsafe situation:
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **TALK**

Talk to children about what is happening in a way that they can understand.

Talk to them about things that are not safe.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PLAN**

Identify a meeting point and make a plan in case you get separated.

Keep children with you or with someone you trust all the time.

Planning with children helps them feel safer too.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **ASSURE**

Assure your children that you will do everything to keep them safe.

Encourage them to share anything that worries them with you.

Be proud of your efforts and try to take care of yourself too.
parenting_crisis_political.video.message: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ tips on how to keep your children safe in an unsafe situation.
parenting_crisis_political.audio.message:
Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ tips on how to keep your children safe in an unsafe situation:

1️⃣ **TALK**
2️⃣ **PLAN**
3️⃣ **ASSURE**
parenting_crisis_political.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Remember that you are not alone and that there are things you can do to keep your children safe.

parenting_crisis_political.introduction.msg_list:
Planning to leave your home during a crisis can be hard because you might not have much time to be ready. 

There are ways to make sure you have what you need to keep your children safe while travelling.
parenting_crisis_political.importance.msg_list: When your children see that you're prepared, it can make them feel more stable even when things around them seem uncertain.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.intro: Here are 5️⃣ tips to help you get ready to travel with children in a crisis situation:
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **IDENTIFY PEOPLE YOU TRUST**

Write the full name & phone number of you and three people you trust.

If you need help with writing, ask someone for help.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PROTECT YOUR DOCUMENTS**

Make backup copies or photos of all your identity documents and keep them safe
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **PLAN**

Tell someone you trust your travel plans, where you are and who you are with.

If a child has a mobile phone, save your number and those of a few trusted people.

Explain to your child how they should behave when at checkpoints (i.e., be quiet, do not leave the vehicle).

Hide money or bank cards in different places, in case you lose your bags. Being prepared takes hard work.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ **COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR CHILD**

Make up a song with your child that has your full name, phone number, and number of someone you trust. Go over it every day so they remember it.

Tell your child where you're going and why in a way they can understand and handle.

Let your children take a comfort item from home with them before leaving if possible.
parenting_crisis_political.video.message: Press Play ▶️ to learn 5️⃣ tips to help you get ready to travel with children in a crisis situation.
parenting_crisis_political.audio.message:
Press Play ▶️ to learn 5️⃣ tips to help you get ready to travel with children in a crisis situation: 
1️⃣ **IDENTIFY PEOPLE YOU TRUST**
2️⃣ **PROTECT YOUR DOCUMENTS**
3️⃣ **PLAN**
4️⃣ **COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR CHILD**
5️⃣ **MAKE AN IDENTITY TAG**
parenting_crisis_political.comic.text.1: You will need something to write on, like paper or cardboard.
parenting_crisis_political.comic.text.2: Ask someone you trust to help you if you need help.
parenting_crisis_political.comic.text.3: On one side, write your child’s full name and phone number of caregivers.
parenting_crisis_political.comic.text.4: On the other side, write any medication your child needs, any special needs or disability.
parenting_crisis_political.comic.text.5: Cover the tag in plastic or a waterproof bag
parenting_crisis_political.comic.text.6: Hide the tag in something your child always wears (e.g., their pocket, or shoe)
parenting_crisis_political.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Everything you do is protecting your children. Well done.

parenting_crisis_political.introduction.msg_list:
Having to travel with children during a crisis can feel scary and hard. 

There are ways to help keep your children away from harm while you are on the move.
parenting_crisis_political.importance.msg_list: Your child will feel reassured knowing you have a plan of action.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.intro: Here are 2️⃣ things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are travelling in a crisis situation:
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **MOVE SAFELY**

Travel with a group of people you know where possible.

If you need to show your passport or ID, try to keep it in your hands.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF**

When it's hard, remember you're trying your best in a difficult situation.

Be sure to look after yourself too.
parenting_crisis_political.video.message: Press Play ▶️ to learn 2️⃣ things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are travelling in a crisis situation.
parenting_crisis_political.audio.message:
Press Play ▶️ to learn 2️⃣ things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are travelling in a crisis situation:

1️⃣ **MOVE SAFELY**
2️⃣ **TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF**
parenting_crisis_political.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. You are making a difference to the safety of your children.

parenting_crisis_political.introduction.msg_list: Human traffickers are people who want to take children away from their families and make money from it. They usually target vulnerable people, like children who are unaccompanied by an adult or are escaping from difficult situations.
parenting_crisis_political.importance.msg_list: Sometimes, children may not realise that they are being tricked by traffickers. They might be scared to report the adult who is threatening them.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ things for you to do to help protect your children from traffickers:
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **TEACH**

Traffickers can be anyone - men, women, couples, and even people from your own community.

Teach your children people sometimes lie and try to trick children into coming with them.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **GET AWAY**

Teach children to trust their instincts and get away if something feels strange.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **TALK**

Tell children to talk to a trusted adult if they feel confused or worried.
parenting_crisis_political.video.message: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ things for you to do to help protect your children from traffickers.
parenting_crisis_political.audio.message:
Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ things for you to do to help protect your children from traffickers: 
1️⃣ **TEACH**
2️⃣ **GET AWAY**
3️⃣ **TALK**
parenting_crisis_political.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today. Talking to children about traffickers can be hard for both you and  your children. Remember to be kind and patient with yourself and your children.

parenting_crisis_political.module_name: Care for your Children in a Shelter
parenting_crisis_political.introduction.msg_list: Being in a shelter can be lonely and stressful for children.
parenting_crisis_political.importance.msg_list: There are things you already know how to do, like doing daily activities and practising self-care. These can help you and your children feel safe and secure in a new place.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ new tips that will help you to support your children in a shelter:
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **MAKE IT FAMILIAR**

If possible,take a comfort item from home with them to a shelter

Decorate the shelter together, with notes or pictures for the walls if you can.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **FIND THE POSITIVE**

Find something to smile about together. 

Share one good thing that happened at the end of each day with your child - no matter how small.
parenting_crisis_political.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ **REASSURE**

Try to reassure your children as often as you can. 

For younger children, you may want to give them a hug or hold them when they are feeling scared. 

For older children, let them know that you are here for them and give them the space to talk to you.
parenting_crisis_political.video.message: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ new tips that will help you to support your children in a shelter.
parenting_crisis_political.audio.message:
Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ new tips that will help you to support your children in a shelter:

1️⃣ **MAKE IT FAMILIAR**
2️⃣ **FIND THE POSITIVE**
3️⃣ **REASSURE**
parenting_crisis_political.congratulations.msg_list: Thank you for joining us today.  Remember that your children learn from you, so taking good care of yourself every day will help them take care of themselves too. You can do it!
